about_the_game:
EDEN: A Genesis Through Time Soundtrack

Enjoy the sounds that accompany your journey throughout the EDEN03 Spacecraft.
The Soundtrack stays true to the limitations of the vintage sound chips of the late 80s
This Soundtrack includes three bonus tracks that did not make it to the release of the game.

The distortion and frequent heavy tones are a staple of the theme acting like a motif for the story told in the game.

About the Track

Wroth
She's not happy...
Imagine living your inevitable downfall a million times just to experience it again all the while retaining hope that it could go your way just this once.
This track uses Eve's signature screeching as a backdrop to the bass heavy battle banger.
Birthday Party
This track was made initially after "What Did You Say?" for my Birthday card invitation. It differs in length and includes some hi-hats that accentuate the sense of urgency.
Keeping the track as part of the trailer made sense as essentially
the player always comes to life from the Medbay.
Combat
The enemies in the game needed a sound that would alert the player that this room is dangerous... The easiest way was to start the track with a thunderous noise followed by a fast paced tune.
Countdown
I wanted something similar to Alien's Mother self destruct so I made sure to include a distorted hum behind the main alarm.
To make it more appealing I added a tick in between the beeps to make it more musical.
We Are Sisters
The depressing adagio instills a feeling of... regret? The sounds here are a foreshadowing to Eve's reveal.
